critique: This executive order focuses on conservation and natural beauty. It establishes a council and a committee to advise the President on matters related to outdoor recreation and beautification. There's no direct indication of a liberal or conservative ideology. It doesn't touch on immigration, civil liberties, or economic regulation. It does expand federal coordination, suggesting a slight increase in federal power. It promotes a general sense of social well-being through access to nature, which could be seen as slightly leaning towards social inclusion.
